citation.article-title: Peptoniphilus methioninivorax sp. nov., a Gram-positive anaerobic coccus isolated from retail ground beef
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Peptoniphilus methioninivorax sp. nov.

Peptoniphilus methioninivorax (me.thi.o.ni.ni.vo′rax. N.L. n. methioninum methionine; L. adj. vorax devouring, ravenous, voracious, consuming; N.L. masc. adj. methioninivorax glycyl l-methionine-consuming).
Cells are coccus-shaped, 0.6–1.0 µm in diameter.
Growth temperature range is between 15 and 42 °C, with optimal growth at 37 °C.
Colonies are small (1–2 mm diameter), smooth, translucent and circular on liver infusion agar plates after 48 h of growth.
Growth is observed in liver infusion liquid media supplemented with 5 % NaCl after 48 h.
Growth on mineral salts liquid medium supplemented with glycyl l-methionine (2 %, w/v) as the sole carbon source is observed as a biofilm (surface pellicle) after 48 h.
The fermentation products produced include acetate (major product), butyrate and propionate (trace amounts).
In addition to the properties indicated in Table 1, cannot utilize any other compounds provided in the anaerobe identification test panel (http://www.biolog.com/pdf/AnbBrochure.pdf).
Positive reactions are obtained for leucine arylamidase and acid phosphatase using the API ZYM system; weak reactions are obtained for esterase, esterase lipase and cystine arylamidase.
The peptidoglycan is of type A4β, l-Orn–d-Glu.
The type strain is NRRL B-23883T ( = DSM 22461T), isolated from a retail sample of ground beef.
The genomic DNA G+C content of the type strain is 32 mol% using the thermal denaturation method (Marmur & Doty, 1962).
